text: Mpho Benjamin Links (born 20 June 1995) is a South African athlete specialising in the high jump. He won a bronze medal at the 2018 African Championships. His personal best in the event is 2.25 metres set in Germiston in 2019. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |rowspan=3|2015 |African Junior Championships |Addis Ababa, Ethiopia |bgcolor=silver|2nd |2.10 m |- |Universiade |Gwangju, South Korea |12th |2.10 m |- |African Games |Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo |6th |2.13 m |- |2017 |Universiade |Taipei, Taiwan |7th |2.23 m |- |2018 |African Championships |Asaba, Nigeria |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |2.15 m |- |rowspan=2|2019 |Universiade |Naples, Italy |5th |2.21 m |- |African Games |Rabat, Morocco |bgcolor=gold | 1st |2.20 m |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:South African male high jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 African Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 African Games Category:African Games competitors for South Africa Category:African Games gold medalists for South Africa Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:South African Athletics Championships winners Category:African Games gold medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Competitors at the 2015 Summer Universiade Category:Competitors at the 2017 Summer Universiade Category:Competitors at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Mpho Links
